OVERVIEW


IIt’s no secret that it’s a challenging time for companies in the electric industry. A big reason: changes in the regulatory
              environment, particularly the new NERC Reliability Standards. How can companies assess their situations, prioritize their
              responses to new requirements, and meet the expectations of regulators, customers and shareholders? Because of the
              complexity of the NERC Reliability Standards, companies now need to view their entire business applications portfolio as
            one integrated, complementary and consistent system architecture.
 Business Performance Management (BPM) frameworks help energy organizations achieve compliance and automation in
                      areas such as planning, budgeting, modeling, and forecasting. Using BPM best practices, organizations collaboratively
                      align information management processes with planning and reporting functions. Outcomes are based on key performance
                      indicators (KPIs) to ensure effective performance monitoring. Context is created for long-term analysis and optimization. As a result, BPM becomes a mechanism to unleash the "right information" at the "right time" in the "right context" to
                      achieve the "right result" for complying with the NERC Reliability Standards.
 In this Workshop, you will:

 Learn how other companies are addressing the NERC Reliability Standards
 Gain valuable perspectives on the top issues and obstacles for meeting the challenges ahead
 Come away with practical advice through “Best Practices” examples on how to simplify the complexity of the 100 or so
                        new Reliability Standards and the thousand or so new processes necessary to operate your assets, manage data, report
                        and audit compliance
 Understand the value of using Business Performance Management to create a foundation to achieve the NERC
                        Reliability Standards while establishing a framework for continuous improvement to manage the certain changes ahead

Who Will Benefit From This Conference 

 Generation & transmission executives who need a good understanding of the potential impacts of the NERC Reliability
                        Standards
 Employees of RTOs, attorneys, and regulators who need to understand the impacts of the new NERC Reliability
                        Standards on their organization
 Program/Project Managers charged with the responsibility of “Setting the Course” to achieve the new NERC Reliability
                        Standards
